intro: Begonia juninensis, commonly known as the Junín begonia, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its striking, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and can vary in color from deep green to reddish hues. The flowers, which bloom in shades of red, orange, and yellow, are often borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. This plant thrives in cool, humid environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
